Black Hole Modifier sample

Description :

This plug-in is an example of creating a world-space modifier that can deform geometry in the scene. As the name implies, world-space modifiers act in the world-space of the scene. Unlike local modifiers, a world-space modifier can deform the geometry of any object in the scene. This example implements a world space modifier that has a speherical area of influence in the scene. Any geometry that is within the area of influence is stretched toward the center of the sphere, sort of like a - dare I say it? - Black Hole. While it is unlikely to find a place in your daily workflow, this example shows implementations of several important DAZ Studio SDK concepts.

 
Concepts Covered :
  • Addition of a new World-Space Modifier type by inheriting DzWSModifier
  • Addition of a new Node type by inheriting DzNode
  • Addition of a new Action type by inheriting DzCreateItemAction
  • Using DAZ Studio native scene file I/O to save data for new types
  • Using the Signals/Slots architecture to implement real-time updates
  • Drawing a custom representation of a scene item using OpenGL
  • Suggested coding standards and project layout
 
Files : ./sdk/samples/modifiers/DzBlackHole

dzblackholemod.cpp The world-space modifier subclass implementation.

dzblackholenode.h The header for the node that controls a Black Hole modifier.
